bug.short_desc: JDT project page is missing a lot of information

long_desc.thetext:
Today I tried to look at the jdt/ui project plan and went to the JDT project site at http://www.eclipse.org/projects/project_summary.php?projectid=eclipse.jdt coming from the projects page (http://www.eclipse.org/projects/listofprojects.php):
- There is no way to navigate to the jdt/ui project page anymore - If I click on the project plan link I get a 404
On the project status infrastructure explanation page (http://www.eclipse.org/projects/dev_process/project-status-infrastructure.php) it says I should do something with something (Data Storage w/ Link to How to Update) called projectplanurl on the committers portal site, but on the portal site I can't find anything called projectplanurl/project plan.
I'm kinda lost here... What happened to the old jdt site http://www.eclipse.org/jdt/ ?

Benno, there were two bugs which have now been fixed. 1) the project web page wasn't showing up on the summary page. 2) the project plan lister was not able to handle multiple plans like the JDT site had listed in the meta-data.
Both have been fixed.
As for updating the meta-data, it's exactly the same meta-data as used to be stored in the project-info.xml files that you guys maintained. It's just that now it's in a database and you can maintain it directly from the portal. Go to the portal and click on "[maintain] Project Info meta-data". You can then edit any of the fields from the former XML file.
